ygData.subject: Connecting to JMX eventually fails after many calls
ygData.msgSnippet: So, I have a simple class to invoke crawl jobs on Heritrix via JMX. It seems to work fine for about 600 total jobs submitted, but eventually I cannot connect

So, I have a simple class to invoke crawl jobs on Heritrix via JMX. 
It see=
ms to work fine for about 600 total jobs submitted, but
eventually I cannot=
 connect to the MBean server (or the WebUI);  I'll
just get socket timeout =
exceptions.  I can't connect via either the
JConsole application nor the co=
mmand line also.

The process is that I have 10 heritrix instances up (with=
in the one
jvm) and I look for an available crawler mbean (via a jmx query)=
 when
a job needs to be submitted.

Does anyone know of any issues like thi=
s?  I am using Heritrix 1.12.1
and java build 1.5.0_11-b03.

I see no OOME =
or anything in the logs.  But, if I run 'top' I can see
that the CPU usage =
has spiked to 100%.  But, the current crawls I have
seem to be stalled (no =
more output to the logs or the arc files have
been appended for over a day)=
.

I hope this is enough info to jog some memories if the issue has been
se=
en before.


--briggs
